articles.headline: Instagram Is Trying to Curb Bullying. First, It Needs to Define Bullying.
articles.snippet: The effort is part of a larger attempt by Instagram and its parent company, Facebook, to clean themselves up.
articles.abstract: The effort is part of a larger attempt by Instagram and its parent company, Facebook, to clean themselves up.
articles.lead_paragraph: If you were to rank all the ways humans can inflict harm on one another, ranked by severity, it might be a few pages before you got to “intentional inducement of FOMO.”

articles.headline: Rudy Giuliani Plans Ukraine Trip to Push for Inquiries That Could Help Trump
articles.snippet: The president’s personal lawyer is stepping up efforts to urge the Ukrainian government to wade into United States politics by pursuing investigations that touch on Joe Biden and Paul Manafort.
articles.abstract: The president’s personal lawyer is stepping up efforts to urge the Ukrainian government to wade into United States politics by pursuing investigations that touch on Joe Biden and Paul Manafort.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Rudolph W. Giuliani, President Trump’s personal lawyer, is encouraging Ukraine to wade further into sensitive political issues in the United States, seeking to push the incoming government in Kiev to press ahead with investigations that he hopes will benefit Mr. Trump.

articles.headline: A New Revolution? Mexico Still Waiting as López Obrador Nears Half-Year Mark
articles.snippet: The new country President Andrés Manuel López Obrador says he is building looks an awful lot like the old one he swore to leave behind in the campaign.
articles.abstract: The new country President Andrés Manuel López Obrador says he is building looks an awful lot like the old one he swore to leave behind in the campaign.
articles.lead_paragraph: MEXICO CITY — After his landslide victory last year, President Andrés Manuel López Obrador of Mexico promised a staggering transformation of his country — on par with independence from Spain and the Mexican Revolution.
articles.byline: By Azam Ahmed and Kirk Semple

articles.headline: Trump Considers Them Terrorists, but Some Are Allies
articles.snippet: President Trump’s proposal to designate the Muslim Brotherhood as a terrorist group risks upsetting American allies from Turkey to Indonesia.
articles.abstract: President Trump’s proposal to designate the Muslim Brotherhood as a terrorist group risks upsetting American allies from Turkey to Indonesia.
articles.lead_paragraph: LONDON — In Kuwait, the Muslim Brotherhood is vocally pro-American.

articles.headline: Argentina’s Economic Misery Could Bring Populism Back to the Country
articles.snippet: Argentina’s turn away from populism and embrace of market forces has enraged people who have lost aid without producing a promised economic revival.
articles.abstract: Argentina’s turn away from populism and embrace of market forces has enraged people who have lost aid without producing a promised economic revival.
articles.lead_paragraph: GREGORIO DE LAFERRERE, Argentina — The turquoise paint is peeling from the walls of Claudia Veronica Genovesi’s modest home. Her roof leaks, but she and her husband — both office cleaners — cannot afford to patch it.

articles.headline: Trump Renews Trade War as China Talks End Without a Deal
articles.snippet: The president, in a series of tweets, said a prolonged trade war would be good for America even as negotiators returned to the table.
articles.abstract: The president, in a series of tweets, said a prolonged trade war would be good for America even as negotiators returned to the table.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Trade talks between China and the United States ended on Friday without a deal as President Trump raised tariffs on $200 billion worth of Chinese imports and signaled he was prepared for a prolonged economic fight.
articles.byline: By Alan Rappeport and Ana Swanson

articles.headline: Uber’s Stock Disappoints, Capping a Rocky Path to Its I.P.O.
articles.snippet: Last year, investment bankers said the company could be valued at $120 billion upon its I.P.O. That number has declined in recent weeks.
articles.abstract: Last year, investment bankers said the company could be valued at $120 billion upon its I.P.O. That number has declined in recent weeks.
articles.lead_paragraph: Over the past decade, Uber changed urban transportation, disrupted entrenched taxi industries, defied regulators the world over and beat back questions about how it was altering the nature of work.
